title: Study Questions
description: Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text

questions.q: When approaching a stop sign, you should:

options.option: Slow down, but only stop if there is oncoming traffic
Stop completely and check for traffic before proceeding
Speed up to clear the intersection quickly
Honk your horn to alert other drivers

questions.q: What does a yellow traffic light indicate?

options.option: Stop
Proceed with caution
Speed up to clear the intersection
Change lanes

questions.q: The legal blood alcohol concentration (BAC) limit for driving in most states is:
When making a right turn at a red light after a complete stop, you must:

options.option: Yield to pedestrians and vehicles with the right-of-way
Proceed without stopping further
Only turn if there are no cars in sight
Make the turn quickly to avoid holding up traffic

questions.q: When merging onto a freeway, you should:

options.option: Stop at the end of the ramp and wait for a gap in traffic
Match the speed of traffic and merge when safe
Come to a complete stop on the freeway before merging
Merge as quickly as possible regardless of other traffic

questions.q: When driving in foggy conditions, you should:

options.option: Turn on your high beams to see better
Drive with your hazard lights on
Use low beam headlights and reduce your speed
Speed up to get out of the fog quickly

questions.q: What does a solid yellow line on the road indicate?

options.option: Passing is allowed
Passing is not allowed
Passing is allowed only during daylight hours
Passing is allowed only if the car ahead is going too slow

questions.q: When approaching a roundabout, you should:

options.option: Always yield to vehicles already in the roundabout
Speed up to beat the traffic already in the roundabout
Sound your horn to alert other drivers of your presence
Proceed without yielding if there are no cars in the roundabout

questions.q: When parallel parking, you should:

options.option: Keep your wheels straight to prevent rolling
Park as close to the curb as possible
Park at least 18 inches from the curb
Park with your wheels turned towards the curb

questions.q: When following another vehicle at night, you should:

options.option: Keep your headlights on high beam
Maintain a safe following distance and use low beam headlights
Tailgate to maintain visibility
Use your horn intermittently to alert the driver ahead

questions.q: If you're involved in a collision, you must:

options.option: Always admit fault to avoid legal complications
Exchange information with other involved parties and notify your insurance company
Leave the scene immediately if there are no injuries
Move the vehicles involved to avoid blocking traffic

questions.q: When driving in heavy rain, you should:

options.option: Turn on your hazard lights and drive faster to reach your destination quickly
Use low beam headlights and increase your following distance
Use cruise control to maintain a steady speed
Honk your horn to alert other drivers of your presence

questions.q: When a school bus is stopped with its red lights flashing and its stop sign extended, you must:

options.option: Slow down and proceed with caution
Pass the bus if you're in a hurry
Stop until the lights stop flashing and the sign is retracted
Ignore the bus and continue driving

questions.q: If you encounter a bicyclist on the road, you should:

options.option: Honk your horn to alert them of your presence
Give them at least 3 feet of clearance when passing
Swerve around them as quickly as possible
Tailgate to encourage them to move over

questions.q: What does a solid white line on the road indicate?

options.option: Passing is allowed
Passing is not allowed
Passing is allowed only during daylight hours
Passing is allowed only if the car ahead is going too slow

questions.q: When driving in heavy traffic, you should:

options.option: Tailgate to maintain your position in the flow of traffic
Keep switching lanes to find the fastest route
Maintain a safe following distance and be patient
Use your horn frequently to alert other drivers

questions.q: When approaching a railroad crossing with flashing lights and gates down, you should:

options.option: Speed up to clear the tracks before the train arrives
Stop and wait until the lights stop flashing and the gates are raised
Drive around the gates if you don't see a train coming
Drive over the tracks quickly to avoid being stuck behind the gates

questions.q: What does a green arrow signal indicate?

options.option: Stop
Proceed with caution
Proceed only in the direction of the arrow
Change lanes

questions.q: When parking uphill with a curb, you should:

options.option: Turn your wheels away from the curb
Turn your wheels towards the curb
Keep your wheels straight
Park at least 18 inches away from the curb

questions.q: When driving in a roundabout, you should:

options.option: Use the left lane to exit if possible
Use the right lane to exit if possible
Drive in the opposite direction of traffic to exit quickly
Stop in the middle of the roundabout if you're unsure of which exit to take

questions.q: If you miss your exit on a freeway, you should:

options.option: Stop and reverse back to the exit
Continue driving until you reach the next exit
Make a U-turn across the median
Drive in reverse on the shoulder until you reach the exit

questions.q: When approaching a pedestrian crossing, you should:

options.option: Speed up to get through before the pedestrians
Slow down and be prepared to stop
Honk your horn to alert pedestrians of your presence
Ignore the pedestrian crossing and continue driving

questions.q: If your vehicle starts to hydroplane, you should:

options.option: Steer straight and gradually reduce speed
Slam on the brakes to regain control
Accelerate to gain traction
Swerve from side to side to break the water surface tension

questions.q: When driving on a highway, you should:

options.option: Drive at a speed that feels comfortable to you
Use the left lane for slower-moving vehicles
Use the right lane for passing and the left lane for cruising
Follow the flow of traffic, regardless of speed limits

questions.q: What does a flashing yellow traffic light indicate?

options.option: Stop
Proceed with caution
Speed up to clear the intersection
Change lanes

questions.q: When making a left turn at a green light, you should:

options.option: Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians
Proceed without yielding
Sound your horn to alert other drivers
Ignore oncoming traffic and turn quickly

questions.q: When driving in snowy conditions, you should:

options.option: Use snow tires or chains and reduce your speed
Increase your speed to reach your destination quicker
Use your horn to alert other drivers
Keep your high beam headlights on for better visibility

questions.q: What should you do if you're being tailgated?

options.option: Slam on your brakes to teach the tailgater a lesson
Speed up to get away from the tailgater
Increase your following distance and let the tailgater pass
Ignore the tailgater and maintain your speed

questions.q: When driving behind a motorcycle, you should:

options.option: Maintain a safe following distance
Tailgate to encourage the motorcyclist to speed up
Drive as close to the motorcycle as possible
Overtake the motorcycle as soon as possible
